lead_paragraph: A unanimous court ruled on Tuesday that Samsung may not have to pay $399 million in damages for copying parts of the iPhone’s distinctive look.

byline.contributor: Adam Liptak reported from Washington, and Vindu Goel from San Francisco.
byline.original: By ADAM LIPTAK and VINDU GOEL

headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Offers No Clear Answer in Samsung-Apple Patent Case
headline.main: Supreme Court Gives Samsung a Reprieve in Apple Patent Case

snippet: A unanimous court ruled on Tuesday that Samsung may not have to pay $399 million in damages for copying parts of the iPhone’s distinctive look....
abstract: Supreme Court unanimously rules Samsung may not have to pay $399 million in damages for copying specific elements of Apple iPhone design; justices decline to give clear answer to case, except to affirm that liability in design patent cases can apply to entire product or components, forcing Apple and Samsung to go back to court to settle on appropriate amount of damages.
